query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: Report on the most optimal configuration for lipid and protein extraction with proposed a scale-up scheme.
result.description: This document will report the computer aided process engineering tools used to support the extraction of lipids and protein from the green juice in solvent selection and solvent recovery. Beside technical feasibility, sustainability aspects as well as economic aspects will be reported in close collaboration with WP10.

result.title: Social security measures (Report)
result.description: The Report will focus on the different approaches EU social security law undertakes with regards to each VUP Group The aim is to suggest measures to fill the social protection coverage gaps and to ensure benefits rights also to VUP Groups so as to prevent them from falling into poverty while respecting the financial sustainability of social security systems

result.title: Tool kit established and distributed to all partners
result.description: "Tool kit established and distributed to all partners. It will include 1) a description of ""good practices"" of resource management, to be presented in the administrative and financial implementation manual, emphasising the duties of each partner and setting out the project management procedures; 2) a tool (e.g. excel) to monitor expenses (e.g. financial monitoring); 3) common reference documents such as deliverables and milestones list; 4) a common platform that will be set up to facilitate exchanges of documents and storage of projects outputs."

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Increasing the environmental performance of industrial processes in bio-based sectors: construction, woodworking, textiles, pulp and paper and bio-chemicals

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Draft for the Exploitation Plan
result.description: A first version of the CALIMERO Exploitation Plan. This Plan will address the following content: 1) a preliminary foreground identification identification; 2) IPR Management: a solid strategy for the management of IPR within the consortium including agreements on the ownership of any new item that will be developed.; 3) Preliminar protection strategy per result obtained and foreseen; 4) Exploitation strategy per result obtained and foreseen. Related to T6.1

category.title: drones
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/robotics/autonomous robots/drones

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Intermediate DMP
result.description: Intermediate version of the Data Management Plan, including information on: how research data will be collected, processed or generated during the lifetime of the project; what methodology and standards will be adopted; whether and how these data will be shared and/or made open and how will be curated and preserved during and after the project. Related to T7.2

result.title: Most impactful bio-based industrial processes
result.description: This deliverable presents the results of the analysis of data collected in T.1.1, conducted to determine the most critical bio-based sectors, impact categories, life cycle stages, processes and their elementary flows-based PEF/OEF method from EU commission. This analysis is complemented by a geographical assessment of environmental hotspots, based on (industry-specific) process data and supplemented where possible with statistical data. It is relates to T1.2.
